medi:segment.medi:documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number and the further specification of the message type (in data element 1001: Document/message name, coded), such as Pick-up notice, Arrival notice.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - change information
RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - reference to previous message - container pre-notification reference number

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of containers by sea and by inland carriers, such as mode and means of transport, arrival date and time.

medi:segment.medi:documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the inland transport stage (road, rail or inland water), such as mode, voyage number/indication inland transport, identification and type of transport means and inland carrier.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location at which the means of transport is to arrive.
DTM, A segment to indicate the arrival date and time of an inland means of transport, such as: - arrival date/time, estimated

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify a party and/or addresses and related contacts.

medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name and address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department of a message sender and/or message recipient, such as: - information contact

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify a party and/or addresses and related contacts.

medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name and address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to describe the goods items (to be) stuffed in containers.

medi:segment.medi:documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item (to be) stuffed in containers. A goods item can be identified by a goods item number.
FTX,
MEA,
DOC,
DTM,
DTM,
LOC,
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions relating to the goods item, such as: - hazardous cargo
TMP, A segment to specify a temperature setting for a goods item.
RNG, A segment to specify a temperature range setting for a goods item.
SGP, A segment to identify the containers in which goods are transported.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify containers in which goods are transported.

medi:segment.medi:documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the dangerous goods regulations for the corresponding mode of transport, class of dangerous goods, additional dangerous goods code, UN-number.
FTX, A segment to indicate the dangerous goods regulations for the corresponding mode of transport, class of dangerous goods, additional dangerous goods code, UN-number.
DGS, A segment to indicate the dangerous goods regulations for the corresponding mode of transport, class of dangerous goods, additional dangerous goods code, UN-number.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify containers in which goods are transported.

medi:segment.medi:documentation: EQD, A segment to specify a container, size and type used in the transport and full/empty indication; also to specify the type of rail car on which a related container is transported.
RFF, A segment to specify the identifying number associated with the container, such as: - container sequence number - container announcement reference number - referring container sequence number
RFF, A segment to specify the identifying number associated with the container, such as: - container sequence number - container announcement reference number - referring container sequence number
EQN, A segment which can be used in case container numbers are not yet known by the carrier.
MEA, A segment to specify measurement, other than dimensions, associated with the container, such as: - gross weight
MEA, A segment to specify measurement, other than dimensions, associated with the container, such as: - gross weight
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the container, such as: - external equipment dimensions
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the container, such as: - external equipment dimensions
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the container, such as: - external equipment dimensions
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the container, such as: - external equipment dimensions
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the container, such as: - external equipment dimensions
SEL, A segment to identify seal and seal issuer associated with the container, such as shipper, consolidator, carrier (sea) and Customs.
FTX,
EQA, A segment to identify related container and means of transport details (rail), such as: - rail car (to relate to the 'rail car'-qualified EQD-group)

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of containers by sea and by inland carriers, such as mode and means of transport.

medi:segment.medi:documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the main carriage stage of the transport (sea), such as carrier/liner service. Information related to the pre-carriage stage can also be included, such as identification and type of means of transport.
LOC, A segment to indicate locations such as (final) discharge ports and inland locations related to the corresponding transport stage.
DTM, A segment to specify a date/time relating to the transport stage.

NAD, A segment to specify a related address or party, such as: - ordering customer (for container announcement) - agent/representative of the ordering customer (for container announcement) - final place of positioning
CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message, explicitly given by the sender.
